name: Convolver
description:
This algorithm performs real-time convolution of the input signal and another signal (often called an impulse response), which is loaded from the MicroSD card. This is often used for realistic reverb effects, since the required impulse responses can be sampled from a physical location, but the technique is much more general and can be a very creative way to mangle and combine sounds.

Convolution is notoriously CPU-intensive, and the disting NT is a resource-constrained embedded system â€“ you should not expect to achieve the same results as you might in the latest new fangled convolution reverb plug-in in your DAW, with orders of magnitude more CPU power and RAM. However, this algorithm remains a useful tool within the context of a modular synth.

The algorithm is based on the disting EX algorithm of the same name.
use_cases: Master bus insert effect for mix reverb
gui_description: The display shows a graphical representation of the impulse sample on the left side. On the right, it displays mono/stereo processing mode, maximum impulse time (based on current parameters), actual length of the loaded sample file, and overall CPU usage.

specifications.name: Max Impulse Length
specifications.description: The maximum length of the impulse response that can be processed.

specifications.name: Sample Rate
specifications.description: All algorithms run at 48kHz, but internal processing can use lower sample rates for efficiency.

specifications.name: CPU Usage
specifications.description: Convolution is CPU-intensive; performance depends on impulse length, stereo/mono mode, latency settings, and allocated memory.

parameters.name: Partitions
parameters.description: Allows fine-tuning of maximum impulse length and CPU usage.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector for mixing dry and convolved signals.

input_ports.name: Left/mono input
input_ports.description: The left or mono audio input bus for convolution processing.

input_ports.name: Right input
input_ports.description: The right audio input bus (if stereo mode is enabled).

output_ports.name: Left output
output_ports.description: The left audio output bus for the processed signal.

output_ports.name: Right output
output_ports.description: The right audio output bus for the processed signal (if stereo mode is enabled).
